edu.stanford.nlp.ie
Class NERServer

java.lang.Object
  edu.stanford.nlp.ie.NERServer

public class NERServer
extends Object

A named-entity recognizer server for Stanford's NER. Runs on a socket and waits for text to annotate and returns the annotated text. (Internally, it uses the classifyString() method on a classifier, which can be either the default CRFClassifier which is serialized inside the jar file from which it is called, or another classifier which is passed as an argument to the main method.

Author:
Bjorn Aldag
Copyright © 2000 - 2004 Cycorp, Inc. All rights reserved. Permission granted for Stanford to distribute with their NER code by Bjorn Aldag, Christopher Manning 2006 (considerably rewritten)

Constructor Detail

NERServer

public NERServer(int port,
                 AbstractSequenceClassifier asc,
                 String charset)
          throws IOException
Creates a new named entity recognizer server on the specified port.

Parameters:
port - the port this NERServer listens on.
asc - The classifier which will do the tagging
charset - The character set for encoding Strings over the socket stream, e.g., "utf-8"
Throws:
IOException - If there is a problem creating a ServerSocket
Method Detail

run

public void run()
Runs this named entity recognizer server.

main

public static void main(String[] args)
                 throws Exception
Starts this server on the specified port. The classifier used can be either a default one stored in the jar file from which this code is invoked or you can specify it as a filename or as another classifier resource name, which must correspond to the name of a resource in the /classifiers/ directory of the jar file.

Usage: java edu.stanford.nlp.ie.NERServer [-loadClassifier file|-loadJarClassifier resource|-client] -port portNumber

Parameters:
args - Command-line arguments (described above)
Throws:
Exception - If file or Java class problems with serialized classifier
